North Carolina Religious Coalition for Marriage Equality Declaration of Religious Leaders April 19 , 2004	NNP NNP NNP NNP IN NNP NNP NN IN JJ NNS NNP CD , CD
The most fundamental human right , after the necessities of food , clothing and shelter , is the right to affection and the supportive love of other human beings .	DT RBS JJ JJ NN , IN DT NNS IN NN , NN CC NN , VBZ DT NN IN NN CC DT JJ NN IN JJ JJ NNS .
We become most fully human when we love another person .	PRP VBP RBS RB JJ WRB PRP VBP DT NN .
We can grow in our capacity to be human - to be loving - in a family unit .	PRP MD VB IN PRP$ NN TO VB JJ , TO VB JJ , IN DT NN NN .
This right to love and form a family is so fundamental that our United States Constitution takes it for granted in its dedication to " secure the blessings of liberty to ourselves and our posterity . ”	DT NN TO VB CC VB DT NN VBZ RB JJ IN PRP$ NNP NNP NNP VBZ PRP IN VBN IN PRP$ NN TO `` VB DT NNS IN NN IN PRP CC PRP$ NN . ''
The North Carolina Constitution likewise affirms the “ inalienable rights ” of human beings to " life , liberty , the enjoyment of the fruits of their own labor , and the pursuit of happiness . "	DT NNP NNP NNP RB VBZ DT `` JJ NNS '' IN JJ NNS IN `` NN , NN , DT NN IN DT NNS IN PRP$ JJ NN , CC DT NN IN NN . ''
Throughout history , tyrants have known that by denying the right of oppressed peoples to form and nurture families , they can kill the spirit of those peoples .	IN NN , NNS VBP VBN IN IN VBG DT NN IN VBN NNS TO VB CC VB NNS , PRP MD VB DT NN IN DT NNS .
> From the shameful history of slavery in America , the injustice of forbidding people to marry is evident as a denial of a basic human right .	NFP IN DT JJ NN IN NN IN NNP , DT NN IN VBG NNS TO VB VBZ JJ IN DT NN IN DT JJ JJ NN .
The American laws forbidding interracial marriage , now struck down , were clearly discriminatory .	DT JJ NNS VBG JJ NN , RB VBN RP , VBD RB JJ .
Denial of the status of marriage to those who would freely accept its responsibilities creates legal and economic inequities and social injustice .	NN IN DT NN IN NN IN DT WP MD RB VB PRP$ NNS VBZ JJ CC JJ NNS CC JJ NN .
We feel called to protest and oppose this injustice .	PRP VBP VBN TO VB CC VB DT NN .
As religious people , clergy and lay leaders , we are mandated by faith to stand for justice in our common civic life .	IN JJ NNS , NNS CC JJ NNS , PRP VBP VBN IN NN TO VB IN NN IN PRP$ JJ JJ NN .
We oppose the use of sacred texts and religious traditions to deny legal equity to same - gender couples .	PRP VBP DT NN IN JJ NNS CC JJ NNS TO VB JJ NN IN JJ HYPH NN NNS .
As concerned citizens we affirm the liberty of adults of the same gender to love and marry .	IN JJ NNS PRP VBP DT NN IN NNS IN DT JJ NN TO VB CC VB .
We insist that no one , especially the state , is allowed to coerce people into marriage or bar two consenting adults , whether of the same or differing genders , from forming the family unit that lets them be more fully loving , thus more fully human .	PRP VBP IN DT NN , RB DT NN , VBZ VBN TO VB NNS IN NN CC VB CD VBG NNS , IN IN DT JJ CC VBG NNS , IN VBG DT NN NN WDT VBZ PRP VB RBR RB JJ , RB RBR RB JJ .
We respect the fact that debate and discussion continue in many of our religious communities as to the scriptural , theological and liturgical issues involved .	PRP VBP DT NN IN NN CC NN VBP IN JJ IN PRP$ JJ NNS IN IN DT JJ , JJ CC JJ NNS VBN .
However , we draw on our many faith traditions to arrive at a common conviction .	RB , PRP VBP IN PRP$ JJ NN NNS TO VB IN DT JJ NN .
We are resolved that the State should not interfere with same - gender couples who choose to marry and share fully and equally in the rights , responsibilities , and commitments of civil marriage .	PRP VBP VBN IN DT NN MD RB VB IN JJ HYPH NN NNS WP VBP TO VB CC VB RB CC RB IN DT NNS , NNS , CC NNS IN JJ NN .
We affirm freedom of conscience in this matter .	PRP VBP NN IN NN IN DT NN .
We recognize that the state may not require religious groups to officiate at , or bless , same - gender marriages .	PRP VBP IN DT NN MD RB VB JJ NNS TO VB IN , CC VB , JJ HYPH NN NNS .
Likewise , a denial of state civil recognition dishonors the religious convictions of those communities and clergy who officiate at , and bless , same - gender marriages .	RB , DT NN IN NN JJ NN VBZ DT JJ NNS IN DT NNS CC NNS WP VBP IN , CC VBP , JJ HYPH NN NNS .
The state may not favor the convictions of one religious group over another by denying individuals their fundamental right to marry and to have those marriages recognized by civil law .	DT NN MD RB VB DT NNS IN CD JJ NN IN DT IN VBG NNS PRP$ JJ NN TO VB CC TO VB DT NNS VBN IN JJ NN .
As faith leaders , we commit ourselves to public action , visibility , education , and mutual support in the service of the right and freedom to marry .	IN NN NNS , PRP VBP PRP IN JJ NN , NN , NN , CC JJ NN IN DT NN IN DT NN CC NN TO VB .

The One Reason Why All Americans Should Oppose The Nomination Of Samuel Alito	DT CD NN WRB DT NNPS MD VB DT NN IN NNP NNP
He Would Tear Down Our System Of Checks And Balances , Giving Far Too Much Power To The President	PRP MD VB RP PRP$ NN IN NNS CC NNS , VBG RB RB JJ NN IN DT NNP
My Fellow Americans :	PRP$ JJ NNPS :
As many of you may have heard , President Bush has nominated a long - time Federal Judge named Samuel Alito to become the next member of the United States Supreme Court , to fill a vacancy created by the retirement of another member of the Court .	IN JJ IN PRP MD VB VBN , NNP NNP VBZ VBN DT JJ HYPH NN JJ NN VBN NNP NNP TO VB DT JJ NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP , TO VB DT NN VBN IN DT NN IN DT NN IN DT NN .
Under our Constitution , this nomination can not take effect unless and until the United States Senate gives its Consent , as described in our Constitution , Article II , Section 2 .	IN PRP$ NN , DT NN MD RB VB NN IN CC IN DT NNP NNP NNP VBZ PRP$ NN , IN VBN IN PRP$ NN , NN CD , NN CD .
A copy of the Constitution , with links back to the official source , is located at http://loveallpeople.org/usconstitutiona.txt	DT NN IN DT NN , IN NNS RB IN DT JJ NN , VBZ VBN IN ADD
Judge Samuel Alito is very highly qualified by all of the normal standards used to evaluate candidates for this position :	NN NNP NNP VBZ RB RB JJ IN DT IN DT JJ NNS VBN TO VB NNS IN DT NN :
He has a very high intellect .	PRP VBZ DT RB JJ NN .
He graduated very high in his class , from Princeton undergraduate and from Law School at Yale .	PRP VBD RB RB IN PRP$ NN , IN NNP NN CC IN NN NN IN NNP .
He has a long and distinguished record , including many years as a Federal Appeals Judge , the next level below Supreme Court .	PRP VBZ DT JJ CC JJ NN , VBG JJ NNS IN DT JJ NNS NN , DT JJ NN IN NNP NNP .
He has encyclopedic knowledge of hundreds of different Supreme Court cases , and he can recite details from memory .	PRP VBZ JJ NN IN NNS IN JJ NNP NNP NNS , CC PRP MD VB NNS IN NN .
He demonstrates an excellent " Judicial Temperament , " being courteous , mild - mannered , respectful of all people ; careful in his work , meticulous in detail .	PRP VBZ DT JJ `` JJ NN , '' VBG JJ , JJ HYPH JJ , JJ IN DT NNS , JJ IN PRP$ NN , JJ IN NN .
His co-workers love him .	PRP$ NNS VBP PRP .
His fellow judges love him .	PRP$ JJ NNS VBP PRP .
His family loves him .	PRP$ NN VBZ PRP .
President Bush loves him .	NNP NNP VBZ PRP .
Yes , it is true that some people do n't like the way they think he will vote on the Supreme Court .	UH , PRP VBZ JJ IN DT NNS VBP RB VB DT NN PRP VBP PRP MD VB IN DT NNP NNP .
But other people do like the way they think he will vote , and the ones who favor him seem to outnumber the ones who oppose him .	CC JJ NNS VBP VB DT NN PRP VBP PRP MD VB , CC DT NNS WP VBP PRP VBP TO VB DT NNS WP VBP PRP .
So now the Senate is getting ready to vote soon , on whether to approve him or not ; and at this moment ( evening of Jan. 27 , 2006 ) it looks like he has more than the fifty - one votes needed for approval .	RB RB DT NNP VBZ VBG JJ TO VB RB , IN IN TO VB PRP CC RB , CC IN DT NN -LRB- NN IN NNP CD , CD -RRB- PRP VBZ IN PRP VBZ JJR IN DT CD HYPH CD NNS VBN IN NN .
The President is very eager to go ahead quickly and get this vote , because he very much wants to have Samuel Alito on the Supreme Court , to be judging the cases Bush is interested in .	DT NNP VBZ RB JJ TO VB RB RB CC VB DT NN , IN PRP RB RB VBZ TO VB NNP NNP IN DT NNP NNP , TO VB VBG DT NNS NNP VBZ JJ IN .
So there is a lot of hurry - up pressure on the Senate to give its prompt vote of approval .	RB EX VBZ DT NN IN VB HYPH RP NN IN DT NNP TO VB PRP$ JJ NN IN NN .
There is an old saying that applies in this situation : " Act in haste , repent at leisure . "	EX VBZ DT JJ NN WDT VBZ IN DT NN : `` VB IN NN , VB IN NN . ''
Sometimes you can make a bad decision very quickly , then regret it for many years to come .	RB PRP MD VB DT JJ NN RB RB , RB VB PRP IN JJ NNS TO VB .
That is what is about to happen with Judge Samuel Alito , in my opinion , because he has one tragic flaw - a very serious blind spot in his thinking - which makes him completely unacceptable for the position of Supreme Court Justice : He does not really agree with the system of " Checks and Balances " built into the Constitution , and he is ready to start tearing it down in order to follow the " Unitary Executive Theory , " which calls for vastly - increased Presidential Power at the expense of Congress and the Supreme Court .	DT VBZ WP VBZ JJ TO VB IN NN NNP NNP , IN PRP$ NN , IN PRP VBZ CD JJ NN , DT RB JJ JJ NN IN PRP$ NN , WDT VBZ PRP RB JJ IN DT NN IN NNP NNP NN : PRP VBZ RB RB VB IN DT NN IN `` NNS CC NNS '' VBN IN DT NN , CC PRP VBZ JJ TO VB VBG PRP RP IN NN TO VB DT `` NNP NNP NNP , '' WDT VBZ IN RB HYPH VBN JJ NN IN DT NN IN NNP CC DT NNP NNP .
And because of this tragic flaw . . .	CC IN IN DT JJ NN . . .
" He Would Tear Down Our System Of Checks And Balances , Giving Far Too Much Power To The President . "	`` PRP MD VB RP PRP$ NN IN NNS CC NNS , VBG RB RB JJ NN IN DT NNP . ''
In our Constitutional system , we have three branches of the Federal Government : the Legislative , Executive , and Judicial branches .	IN PRP$ JJ NN , PRP VBP CD NNS IN DT NNP NNP : DT JJ , JJ , CC JJ NNS .
And the basic idea behind the Checks and Balances we have is that if one branch of the Government goes crazy , the other two can hold it down .	CC DT JJ NN IN DT NNS CC NNS PRP VBP VBZ IN IN CD NN IN DT NN VBZ JJ , DT JJ CD MD VB PRP RB .
But Samuel Alito believes in a little - known Constitutional theory - called the " Unitary Executive Theory " - which says that the President should have complete control over the Executive Branch , and that the Executive Branch should be in charge of almost everything that the Government actually does , including the functions of the Independent Agencies which were designed to be free of Presidential control , and the Military , which exists , which is regulated , and which is funded by specific authority given by the Constitution to Congress , not to the President .	CC NNP NNP VBZ IN DT RB HYPH VBN JJ NN , VBN DT `` NNP NNP NNP '' , WDT VBZ IN DT NNP MD VB JJ NN IN DT JJ NN , CC IN DT JJ NN MD VB IN NN IN RB NN WDT DT NN RB VBZ , VBG DT NNS IN DT JJ NNS WDT VBD VBN TO VB JJ IN JJ NN , CC DT NN , WDT VBZ , WDT VBZ VBN , CC WDT VBZ VBN IN JJ NN VBN IN DT NN IN NNP , RB IN DT NNP .
The Military is not part of the Executive Branch : it is a separate entity .	DT NN VBZ RB NN IN DT JJ NN : PRP VBZ DT JJ NN .
" Commander In Chief " does n't mean that he is the boss of the Military , merely mean that he is the Administrator , just as he is the Administrator of the Executive Branch , charged with " executing faithfully " all the laws passed by Congress and all the Decisions rendered by the Supreme Court .	`` NNP IN NNP '' VBZ RB VB IN PRP VBZ DT NN IN DT NN , RB VB IN PRP VBZ DT NN , RB IN PRP VBZ DT NN IN DT JJ NN , VBN IN `` VBG RB '' PDT DT NNS VBN IN NNP CC PDT DT NNS VBN IN DT NNP NNP .
Under the Unitary Executive Theory , the Laws of Congress and Decisions of the Supreme Court have no actual authority unless the President agrees with them .	IN DT NNP NNP NNP , DT NNS IN NNP CC NNS IN DT NNP NNP VBP DT JJ NN IN DT NNP VBZ IN PRP .
And so Congress and the Supreme Court become mere advisors to the President , with no real authority over him .	CC RB NNP CC DT NNP NNP VB JJ NNS IN DT NNP , IN DT JJ NN IN PRP .
And the President becomes a Dictator , unrestrained by anything in the Constitution , backed up by the Armed Forces , which would be entirely under his personal control .	CC DT NNP VBZ DT NN , JJ IN NN IN DT NN , VBN RP IN DT JJ NNS , WDT MD VB RB IN PRP$ JJ NN .
And thus the United States of America - The Land Of The Free And The Home Of The Brave - becomes just another Military Dictatorship , no better than Nazi Germany or Fascist Italy during World War II .	CC RB DT NNP NNP IN NNP , DT NN IN DT JJ CC DT NN IN DT JJ , VBZ RB DT JJ NN , RB JJR IN NNP NNP CC JJ NNP IN NNP NNP CD .
AND THAT IS WHY ALL AMERICANS SHOULD OPPOSE THE NOMINATION OF SAMUEL ALITO .	CC DT VBZ WRB DT NNPS MD VB DT NN IN NNP NNP .
For details and further proof , please see these websites :	IN NNS CC JJ NN , UH VB DT NNS :

China launches its second manned spaceflight mission	NNP VBZ PRP$ JJ JJ NN NN
Secretive efforts keep outsiders in the dark about the program 's goals	JJ NNS VBP NNS IN DT NN IN DT NN POS NNS
By MARK CARREAU	IN NNP NNP
Copyright 2005 Houston Chronicle	NN CD NNP NNP
Reuters	NNP
China launched Shenzhou VI , its second manned spacecraft , early today in northwest China 's Gansu Province .	NNP VBD NNP NNP , PRP$ JJ JJ NN , RB NN IN JJ NNP POS NNP NNP .
A pair of military pilots embarked on China 's second manned space flight early today , hurtling into orbit on a test mission that could span five days .	DT NN IN JJ NNS VBD IN NNP POS RB JJ NN NN RB NN , VBG IN NN IN DT NN NN WDT MD VB CD NNS .
The crew of the Shenzhou VI spacecraft was identified as Fei Junlong , 40 , and Nie Haishen , 41 , by China 's official news agency .	DT NN IN DT NNP NNP NN VBD VBN IN NNP NNP , CD , CC NNP NNP , CD , IN NNP POS JJ NN NN .
The successful launch from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center in northwest China follows the solo flight of Yang Liwei in October 2003 .	DT JJ NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP NNP IN JJ NNP VBZ DT JJ NN IN NNP NNP IN NNP CD .
His one - day mission vaulted his communist homeland into the elite circle of spacefaring nations - Russia and the United States - that can launch and sustain humans in space .	PRP$ CD HYPH NN NN VBD PRP$ JJ NN IN DT JJ NN IN JJ NNS , NNP CC DT NNP NNP HYPH WDT MD VB CC VB NNS IN NN .
Most experts believe China intends to develop a small space station of its own over the next several years .	JJS NNS VBP NNP VBZ TO VB DT JJ NN NN IN PRP$ JJ IN DT JJ JJ NNS .
But they remain uncertain about whether China aims to beat the United States to the moon in its secretive space effort .	CC PRP VBP JJ IN IN NNP VBZ TO VB DT NNP NNP IN DT NN IN PRP$ JJ NN NN .
President Bush has directed NASA to return to the moon by 2018 with a new generation of human explorers .	NNP NNP VBZ VBN NNP TO VB IN DT NN IN CD IN DT JJ NN IN JJ NNS .
China 's " is not a fly - by - night program , " said Joan Johnson - Freese , an expert on national security who follows space developments in the Asian nation at the Naval War College in Newport , R.I .	NNP POS `` VBZ RB DT VB HYPH IN HYPH NN NN , '' VBD NNP NNP HYPH NNP , DT NN IN JJ NN WP VBZ NN NNS IN DT JJ NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP IN NNP , NNP .
" They are not in any hurry .	`` PRP VBP RB IN DT NN .
They want a program that will be a success , " Johnson - Freese said .	PRP VBP DT NN WDT MD VB DT NN , '' NNP HYPH NNP VBD .
" They are not going to rush it , because they do n't want it to be a budget buster .	`` PRP VBP RB VBG TO VB PRP , IN PRP VBP RB VB PRP TO VB DT NN NN .
Economics will be a big determiner in the speed of their program . "	NNS MD VB DT JJ NN IN DT NN IN PRP$ NN . ,
China 's overtures to join the U.S. - led effort to develop the 16 - nation international space station have been thwarted for more than a decade over a range of issues , including the Asian country 's human rights policies and worries it could acquire technologies that could pose a security threat .	NNP POS NNS TO VB DT NNP HYPH VBN NN TO VB DT CD HYPH NN JJ NN NN VBP VBN VBN IN JJR IN DT NN IN DT NN IN NNS , VBG DT JJ NN POS JJ NNS NNS CC NNS PRP MD VB NNS WDT MD VB DT NN NN .
The freeze thawed some after Yang 's 2003 mission .	DT NN VBD RB IN NNP POS CD NN .
China was among 30 nations invited to send a delegate to NASA - sponsored roundtable discussions on Bush 's strategy to reach the moon with astronauts as the first step in the exploration of Mars and other - deep space destinations .	NNP VBD IN CD NNS VBN TO VB DT NN IN NNP HYPH VBN NN NNS IN NNP POS NN TO VB DT NN IN NNS IN DT JJ NN IN DT NN IN NNP CC JJ , JJ NN NNS .
" We applaud China 's space achievements , " NASA spokesman Allard Beutel said Tuesday .	`` PRP VBP NNP POS NN NNS , '' NNP NN NNP NNP VBD NNP .
" We wish them a successful return of their astronauts . "	`` PRP VBP PRP DT JJ NN IN PRP$ NNS . ''

Blue Planet : Who 's afraid of Big Bad Wolf ?	NNP NNP : WP VBZ NNP IN NNP NNP NNP .
By Dan Whipple	IN NNP NNP
UNITED PRESS INTERNATIONAL	NNP NNP NNP
Boulder , CO , Feb. 23 ( UPI ) --	NNP , NNP , NNP CD -LRB- NNP -RRB- NFP
Ever since he ate up Red Riding Hood 's grandma and blew down the houses of two - thirds of the Three Little Pigs , the Big Bad Wolf has held a persistently bad reputation .	RB IN PRP VBD RP NNP NNP NNP POS NN CC VBD RP DT NNS IN CD HYPH NNS IN DT NNP NNP NNPS , DT NNP NNP NNP VBZ VBN DT RB JJ NN .
In part because of that reputation , the gray wolf was nearly exterminated from the lower 48 states by the 1920s , except for a small remnant population on Isle Royale National Park in Michigan 's Lake Superior .	IN NN IN IN DT NN , DT JJ NN VBD RB VBN IN DT JJ CD NNS IN DT NNS , IN IN DT JJ NN NN IN NNP NNP NNP NNP IN NNP POS NNP NNP .
The last wolf was killed in Yellowstone National Park in 1943 .	DT JJ NN VBD VBN IN NNP NNP NNP IN CD .
Western sheep and cattle ranchers , on whose behalf this extermination campaign was conducted , gratefully dusted their hands of the wolf and wrote him off as a job well done .	JJ NNS CC NNS NNS , IN WP$ NN DT NN NN VBD VBN , RB VBD PRP$ NNS IN DT NN CC VBD PRP RP IN DT NN RB VBN .
Their sheep could graze , their cows could ruminate and never a discouraging word would be heard .	PRP$ NNS MD VB , PRP$ NNS MD VB CC RB DT JJ NN MD VB VBN .
After the major kill - offs , wolves outside of Alaska and Canada existed mostly as legend .	IN DT JJ NN HYPH NNS , NNS IN IN NNP CC NNP VBD RB IN NN .
Like UFOs or Sasquatch , several people claimed to see fleeting lone wolves , usually in Yellowstone .	IN NNS CC NNP , JJ NNS VBD TO VB JJ JJ NNS , RB IN NNP .
In the 1960s , a group shooting a movie in the Wyoming park reportedly imported some captive wolves , then released them when their shooting was done .	IN DT NNS , DT NN VBG DT NN IN DT NNP NN RB VBD DT JJ NNS , RB VBD PRP WRB PRP$ NN VBD JJ .
If so , this happy band has not been heard from since .	IN RB , DT JJ NN VBZ RB VBN VBN IN RB .
Rumor also had it some renegade biologist brought a caged pair to Yellowstone and released them into the wild sometime in the 1970s , hoping to reestablish a breeding population .	NN RB VBD PRP DT JJ NN VBD DT VBN NN IN NNP CC VBD PRP IN DT NN RB IN DT NNS , VBG TO VB DT VBG NN .
If true , the caper failed .	IN JJ , DT NN VBD .
Over time , the wolf 's absence seemed to rehabilitate its image .	IN NN , DT NN POS NN VBD TO VB PRP$ NN .
Eventually , a trickle of support appeared for bringing the predator back to its former home range in the northern Rocky Mountains .	RB , DT NN IN NN VBD IN VBG DT NN RB IN PRP$ JJ NN NN IN DT JJ NNP NNPS .
This trickle grew into a flood , resulting in 14 wolves being reintroduced in Yellowstone in 1995 by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service -- albeit over the strong and still - continuing objections of ranchers .	DT NN VBD IN DT NN , VBG IN CD NNS VBG VBN IN NNP IN CD IN DT NNP NNP CC NNP NNP , IN IN DT JJ CC RB HYPH VBG NNS IN NNS .
These wolf packs have flourished , and now there are an estimated 850 wolves roaming the northern Rockies , where merely 10 years ago there were none .	DT NN NNS VBP VBN , CC RB EX VBP DT VBN CD NNS VBG DT JJ NNPS , WRB RB CD NNS RB EX VBD NN .
One compelling argument for reintroduction was the wolf acts as a keystone predator , an animal that affects the populations , behavior and ecology of a wide variety of species within its range .	CD JJ NN IN NN VBD DT NN VBZ IN DT NN NN , DT NN WDT VBZ DT NNS , NN CC NN IN DT JJ NN IN NNS IN PRP$ NN .
Some recent research conducted by Oregon State University has given considerable credence to this idea .	DT JJ NN VBN IN NNP NNP NNP VBZ VBN JJ NN IN DT NN .
OSU forestry professors William Ripple and Robert Beschta have found that wolves actually promote stream - bank stabilization , although they have given the phenomenon the unfortunate name of " the ecology of fear " -- something that smacks of the horrible PR resulting from the wolf 's relationships with Riding Hood and the Three Pigs .	NNP NN NNS NNP NNP CC NNP NNP VBP VBN IN NNS RB VB NN HYPH NN NN , IN PRP VBP VBN DT NN DT JJ NN IN `` DT NN IN NN '' , NN WDT VBZ IN DT JJ NN VBG IN DT NN POS NNS IN NNP NNP CC DT NNP NNPS .
They explained that elk in Yellowstone used to browse unmolested on young aspen and willow growing near the banks of streams , a behavior that prevented the saplings from reaching mature stages and increased the possibility of soil erosion .	PRP VBD IN NNS IN NNP VBD TO VB JJ IN JJ NN CC NN VBG IN DT NNS IN NNS , DT NN WDT VBD DT NNS IN VBG JJ NNS CC VBD DT NN IN NN NN .
Since reintroduction , however , Ripple and Beschta have found , fear of the wolves apparently has discouraged the elk from spending too much time at stream banks -- where they are out in the open -- and munching on the saplings .	IN NN , RB , NNP CC NNP VBP VBN , NN IN DT NNS RB VBZ VBN DT NNS IN VBG RB JJ NN IN NN NNS , WRB PRP VBP RB IN DT JJ , CC VBG IN DT NNS .
" All you have to do is look at the photographs , " Ed Bangs , wolf recovery coordinator for the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service , told UPI 's Blue Planet ,	`` DT PRP VBP TO VB VBZ VB IN DT NNS , '' NNP NNP , NN NN NN IN DT NNP NNP CC NNP NNP , VBD NNP POS NNP NNP ,
" You say , ' wow ! '	`` PRP VBP , `` UH . ''
An area that used to be bald as a billiard ball is now a sea of willow . "	DT NN WDT VBD TO VB JJ IN DT NN NN VBZ RB DT NN IN NN . ''
This simple change has triggered a veritable ecological cascade in Yellowstone .	DT JJ NN VBZ VBN DT JJ JJ NN IN NNP .
More streamside willow and aspen have meant better habitat for beaver , for instance .	JJR JJ NN CC NN VBP VBN JJR NN IN NNS , IN NN .
Where there had been only one beaver colony in the park 's northern range before the wolves returned , now there are nine .	WRB EX VBD VBN RB CD NN NN IN DT NN POS JJ NN IN DT NNS VBD , RB EX VBP CD .
" It may be uninteresting to a lot of people , " Beschta told Blue Planet .	`` PRP MD VB JJ IN DT NN IN NNS , '' NNP VBD NNP NNP .
" There 's a lot of impact on plants and they say , ' Who cares ? '	`` EX VBZ DT NN IN NN IN NNS CC PRP VBP , `` WP VBZ . ''
But we 've been looking at streamside communities .	CC PRP VBP VBN VBG IN JJ NNS .
Since wolf recovery , streamside plants , willows and cottonwoods provide food for other critters -- beavers , a whole variety of avian species , berry - producing shrubs that bears can use .	IN NN NN , NN NNS , NNS CC NNS VBP NN IN JJ NNS , NNS , DT JJ NN IN JJ NNS , NN HYPH VBG NNS WDT VBZ MD VB .
It 's important with regard to the quality of streams .	PRP VBZ JJ IN NN IN DT NN IN NNS .
The plants provide shade and root strength for bank stability .	DT NNS VBP NN CC NN NN IN NN NN .
Plants are critical to wildland ecosystems . "	NNS VBP JJ IN NN NNS . ''
Yellowstone has a vast elk herd , one of the largest in the world .	NNP VBZ DT JJ NN NN , CD IN DT JJS IN DT NN .
Bangs said although the number of elk has not declined very much since the wolves came back , their behavior appears markedly different .	NNP VBD IN DT NN IN NNS VBZ RB VBN RB RB IN DT NNS VBD RB , PRP$ NN VBZ RB JJ .
" I 'm pretty suspicious of making broad generalizations , " however , he cautioned .	`` PRP VBP RB JJ IN VBG JJ NNS , '' RB , PRP VBD .
" Wolves are still pretty new .	`` NNS VBP RB RB JJ .
They 've only been there for 10 years .	PRP VBP RB VBN RB IN CD NNS .
In 10 more years we 'll have a better idea . "	IN CD JJR NNS PRP MD VB DT JJR NN . ''
Wolf reintroduction in the northern Rockies has been so successful the Fish and Wildlife Service has moved to reduce the animal 's status from endangered to threatened and , eventually , to remove it from the endangered species list altogether .	NN NN IN DT JJ NNPS VBZ VBN RB JJ DT NNP CC NNP NNP VBZ VBN TO VB DT NN POS NN IN NN IN NN CC , RB , TO VB PRP IN DT JJ NN NN RB .
Bangs said the agency has established viable wolf packs in the northern Rockies , as required by federal regulations .	NNP VBD DT NN VBZ VBN JJ NN NNS IN DT JJ NNPS , IN VBN IN JJ NNS .
Some conservationists want the protection extended so wolves can move into other states , including Colorado , Utah and Oregon , among others .	DT NNS VBP DT NN VBN IN NNS MD VB IN JJ NNS , VBG NNP , NNP CC NNP , IN NNS .
On Jan. 31 , Oregon Federal District Court Judge Robert E. Jones appeared to agree with them .	IN NNP CD , NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP VBD TO VB IN PRP .
He vacated the FWS decision to downgrade the wolf 's status .	PRP VBD DT NNP NN TO VB DT NN POS NN .
Bangs said his agency is still reviewing the decision .	NNP VBD PRP$ NN VBZ RB VBG DT NN .
Regardless of the wolf 's legal status , its future expansion into new areas now seems likely .	RB IN DT NN POS JJ NN , PRP$ JJ NN IN JJ NNS RB VBZ JJ .
Wolves can migrate considerable distances .	NNS MD VB JJ NNS .
A Yellowstone wolf was found dead , hit by a car , on a Colorado highway last year , several hundred miles from home .	DT NNP NN VBD VBN JJ , VBN IN DT NN , IN DT NNP NN JJ NN , JJ CD NNS IN NN .
Meanwhile , his reputation seems to be improving , although Bangs noted a " pretty interesting social dynamic . "	RB , PRP$ NN VBZ TO VB VBG , IN NNP VBD DT `` RB JJ JJ NN . ''
There are only about 850 wolves in the West , but there are an estimated 31,000 mountain lions .	EX VBP RB RB CD NNS IN DT JJ , CC EX VBP DT VBN CD NN NNS .
Pound for pound , mountain lions eat more game and more livestock than wolves .	NN IN NN , NN NNS VBP JJR NN CC JJR NN IN NNS .
They even occasionally attack people , which wolves do not -- despite the propaganda from the Brothers Grimm .	PRP RB RB VBP NNS , WDT NNS VBP RB , IN DT NN IN DT NNPS NNP .
Yet people seem willing -- even eager -- to accommodate mountain lions , despite the risks .	CC NNS VBP JJ , RB JJ , TO VB NN NNS , IN DT NNS .
It remains to be seen whether they will extend the same courtesy to the arriving gray wolf .	PRP VBZ TO VB VBN IN PRP MD VB DT JJ NN IN DT VBG JJ NN .
Regarding those rumors about wolves living in Yellowstone prior to the official reintroduction ?	VBG DT NNS IN NNS VBG IN NNP JJ IN DT JJ NN .
They seem to be just that : rumors .	PRP VBP TO VB RB DT , NNS .
True , there are about 300,000 wolves and wolf hybrids kept as pets in the United States .	JJ , EX VBP RB CD NNS CC NN NNS VBN IN NNS IN DT NNP NNP .
It also is likely people have released some of these animals into the wild hoping they would survive -- for instance , a ranger in Glacier Park caught someone in this very act not long ago .	PRP RB VBZ JJ NNS VBP VBN DT IN DT NNS IN DT NN VBG PRP MD VB , IN NN , DT NN IN NNP NNP VBD NN IN DT JJ NN RB RB RB .
Bangs said these animals are not equipped to survive in the wild , however , and they all almost certainly have died .	NNP VBD DT NNS VBP RB VBN TO VB IN DT NN , RB , CC PRP DT RB RB VBP VBN .
He said after 10 years of DNA testing on northern Rockies wolves , scientists have not found a single strain that did not belong to one of the wolves the agency released -- or their descendants . Climate : Humans fuss , animals adjust	NN : NNS VBP , NNS VBP
By Dan Whipple	IN NNP NNP
UNITED PRESS INTERNATIONAL	NNP NNP NNP
Boulder , CO , Nov. 15 ( UPI ) --	NNP , NNP , NNP CD -LRB- NNP -RRB- ,
Scientists can argue all they want about how many degrees Celsius -- or Fahrenheit -- the planet is warming and what the trend portends , but meanwhile Earth 's plants , insects and animals are not waiting for the outcome .	NNS MD VB RB PRP VBP IN WRB JJ NNS NNP , CC NNP , DT NN VBZ VBG CC WP DT NN VBZ , CC RB NNP POS NNS , NNS CC NNS VBP RB VBG IN DT NN .
They already are altering their patterns of behavior in response to what is happening .	PRP RB VBP VBG PRP$ NNS IN NN IN NN IN WP VBZ VBG .
It turns out one of the surest barometers of the warming climate is the response of the non-human natural world to changing conditions , and biologists who study the responses have been aware for some years the biosphere is acknowledging global warming .	PRP VBZ RP CD IN DT JJS NNS IN DT VBG NN VBZ DT NN IN DT JJ JJ NN IN VBG NNS , CC NNS WP VBP DT NNS VBP VBN JJ IN DT NNS DT NN VBZ VBG JJ NN .
Nina Leopold Bradley , a plant ecologist and daughter of the conservation pioneer Aldo Leopold , published a 1999 paper in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences on her 61 - year uninterrupted phenological records .	NNP NNP NNP , DT NN NN CC NN IN DT NN NN NNP NNP , VBD DT CD NN IN DT NNPS IN DT NNP NNP IN NNPS IN PRP$ CD HYPH NN JJ JJ NNS .
Phenology studies an organism 's development and life cycle -- the pulse of life .	NN VBZ DT NN POS NN CC NN NN , DT NN IN NN .
Bradley 's record of 300 phenophases found that even prior to 1999 , spring was arriving in higher latitudes several weeks earlier than in the earlier years of her data .	NNP POS NN IN CD NNS VBD IN RB JJ IN CD , NN VBD VBG IN JJR NNS JJ NNS RBR IN IN DT JJR NNS IN PRP$ NN .
Birds arrived sooner on their migrations from the south and plants flowered earlier .	NNS VBD RBR IN PRP$ NNS IN DT NN CC NNS VBD RBR .
The Eastern phoebe is showing up about 20 days before it used to .	DT JJ NN VBZ VBG RP RB CD NNS IN PRP VBD TO .
The forest phlox is blooming in late April instead of mid-May .	DT NN NN VBZ VBG IN JJ NNP RB IN NNP .
Half of the 300 phenophases Leopold tracked showed a response consistent with warming .	NN IN DT CD NNS NNP VBD VBD DT NN JJ IN NN .
In England , the cuckoo returns earlier .	IN NNP , DT NN VBZ RBR .
An analysis of 65 bird species in the United Kingdom shows about one - third are laying their eggs four to seven days earlier than they did 25 years ago .	DT NN IN CD NN NNS IN DT NNP NNP VBZ RB CD HYPH NN VBP VBG PRP$ NNS CD IN CD NNS RBR IN PRP VBD CD NNS RB .
" One of the major , most well - documented and robust findings in ecology over the past century has been the crucial role of climate in determining the geographical distribution of species and ecological communities , " concluded a report titled " Observed Impacts of Global Climate Change in the United States , " released by the Pew Center on Global Climate last week .	`` CD IN DT JJ , RBS RB HYPH VBN CC JJ NNS IN NN IN DT JJ NN VBZ VBN DT JJ NN IN NN IN VBG DT JJ NN IN NNS CC JJ NNS , '' VBD DT NN VBN `` VBN NNPS IN NNP NNP NNP IN DT NNP NNP , '' VBN IN DT NNP NNP IN NNP NNP JJ NN .
Pew researchers looked at about 40 studies that could provide an assessment of whether climate was affecting biology .	NNP NNS VBD IN RB CD NNS WDT MD VB DT NN IN IN NN VBD VBG NN .
" Half of the studies provide strong evidence of a causal link between the biological change and climate change , " said Camille Parmesan , a University of Texas - Austin biologist and one of the world 's leading experts on this issue .	`` NN IN DT NNS VBP JJ NN IN DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NN CC NN NN , '' VBD NNP NNP , DT NNP IN NNP HYPH NNP NN CC CD IN DT NN POS VBG NNS IN DT NN .
These changes are occurring across all species , Parmesan told UPI 's Climate .	DT NNS VBP VBG IN DT NNS , NNP VBD NNP POS NNP .
" Across the United States , the northern edge of species ' range is expanding , " she said .	`` IN DT NNP NNP , DT JJ NN IN NNS POS NN VBZ VBG , '' PRP VBD .
Parmesan has spent much of her career studying the checkerspot butterfly , which migrates between Mexico and southern California .	NNP VBZ VBN JJ IN PRP$ NN VBG DT NN NN , WDT VBZ IN NNP CC JJ NNP .
Some localized extinctions already have occurred across some of its habitat .	DT VBN NNS RB VBP VBN IN DT IN PRP$ NN .
" Empirical research pointed to climate as being a strong driver , " she said .	`` JJ NN VBD IN NN IN VBG DT JJ NN , '' PRP VBD .
" There have been large numbers of population extinctions in Mexico and southern California in areas where the habitat is still acceptable . "	`` EX VBP VBN JJ NNS IN NN NNS IN NNP CC JJ NNP IN NNS WRB DT NN VBZ RB JJ . ''
According to Parmesan 's earlier studies , one extinction event , for instance , was triggered when a checkerspot population migrated north prematurely , relying on a warming temperature signal , then was caught in a severe snowstorm in its northern habitat .	VBG IN NNP POS JJR NNS , CD NN NN , IN NN , VBD VBN WRB DT NN NN VBD RB RB , VBG IN DT VBG NN NN , RB VBD VBN IN DT JJ NN IN PRP$ JJ NN .
Throughout the United States , she said , " spring is about two weeks earlier .	IN DT NNP NNP , PRP VBD , `` NN VBZ RB CD NNS JJR .
Tree swallows are nesting nine days earlier .	NN NNS VBP VBG CD NNS RBR .
Tropical species have moved up to Florida and the Gulf Coast .	JJ NNS VBP VBN IN IN NNP CC DT NNP NNP .
Bird and butterfly watchers are seeing many , many new species coming up from Mexico and the Caribbean . "	NN CC NN NNS VBP VBG JJ , JJ JJ NNS VBG RB IN NNP CC DT NNP . ''
As the Pew report concluded , " Sufficient studies now exist to conclude that the consequences of climate change are already detectable within U.S. ecosystems . "	IN DT NNP NN VBD , `` JJ NNS RB VBP TO VB IN DT NNS IN NN NN VBP RB JJ IN NNP NNS . ''
Such consequences include shifting and , in some cases , contraction of ranges and changes in species composition within ecosystems .	JJ NNS VBP NN CC , IN DT NNS , NN IN NNS CC NNS IN NN NN IN NNS .
The report also found alterations of ecosystem processes such as carbon cycling and storage .	DT NN RB VBD NNS IN NN NNS JJ IN NN NN CC NN .
The Alaskan tundra , for instance , has switched from being a net sink of carbon dioxide -- absorbing and storing more carbon from the atmosphere than it releases -- to " being a net source of CO2 ( releasing more carbon than is stored ) because warmer winters have allowed dead plant matter previously stored in the soil to decompose and release CO2 . "	DT JJ NN , IN NN , VBZ VBN IN VBG DT NN NN IN NN NN , VBG CC VBG JJR NN IN DT NN IN PRP VBZ , IN `` VBG DT NN NN IN NN -LRB- VBG JJR NN IN VBZ VBN -RRB- IN JJR NNS VBP VBN JJ NN NN RB VBN IN DT NN TO VB CC VB NN . ''
The Pew report coincided with the release in Iceland of the " Arctic Climate Impact Assessment . "	DT NNP NN VBD IN DT NN IN NNP IN DT `` NNP NNP NNP NNP . ''
The ACIA -- with participation by the United States , Canada , Denmark , Finland , Iceland , Norway , the Russian Federation and Sweden -- was begun in 2000 .	DT NNP , IN NN IN DT NNP NNP , NNP , NNP , NNP , NNP , NNP , DT NNP NNP CC NNP , VBD VBN IN CD .
" The impacts of global warming are affecting people now in the Arctic , " said ACIA chair Robert Corell .	`` DT NNS IN JJ NN VBP VBG NNS RB IN DT NNP , '' VBD NNP NN NNP NNP .
" The Arctic is experiencing some of the most rapid and severe climate change on Earth .	`` DT NNP VBZ VBG DT IN DT RBS JJ CC JJ NN NN IN NNP .
The impacts of climate change on the region and the globe are projected to increase substantially in the years to come . "	DT NNS IN NN NN IN DT NN CC DT NN VBP VBN TO VB RB IN DT NNS TO VB . ''
The ACIA found Arctic winter temperatures have increased 4 degrees to 7 degrees Fahrenheit in the last 50 years and should go up about twice that much in the next 100 years .	DT NNP VBD JJ NN NNS VBP VBN CD NNS IN CD NNS NNP IN DT JJ CD NNS CC MD VB RB RB RB RB RB IN DT JJ CD NNS .
Arctic summer sea ice will decline by 50 percent by the end of the 21st century , the assessment found , with some models predicting complete disappearance of summer sea ice .	JJ NN NN NN MD VB IN CD NN IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN , DT NN VBD , IN DT NNS VBG JJ NN IN NN NN NN .
" Should the Arctic Ocean become ice - free in summer , it is likely that polar bears and some seal species would be driven toward extinction , " the report concluded .	`` MD DT NNP NNP VB NN HYPH JJ IN NN , PRP VBZ JJ IN JJ NNS CC DT NN NNS MD VB VBN IN NN , '' DT NN VBD .
As with so much climate research , not everyone agrees with these dire predictions .	IN IN RB JJ NN NN , RB NN VBZ IN DT JJ NNS .
A third report , " The Impacts of Climate Change : An Appraisal for the Future , " completed by the Britain - based International Policy Network and released almost simultaneously with the other two , falls somewhat into that category .	DT JJ NN , `` DT NNPS IN NNP NNP : DT NNP IN DT NNP , '' VBN IN DT NNP HYPH VBN NNP NNP NNP CC VBN RB RB IN DT JJ CD , VBZ RB IN DT NN .
On the one hand , the IPN report agreed " Climate models generally predict that the temperature rises in the Arctic will substantially exceed the global rise .	IN DT CD NN , DT NNP NN VBD `` NN NNS RB VB IN DT NN NNS IN DT NNP MD RB VB DT JJ NN .
This applies especially in the high Arctic where the ice cover is expected to diminish substantially with the effect that the surface absorption of solar radiation will greatly increase . "	DT VBZ RB IN DT JJ NNP WRB DT NN NN VBZ VBN TO VB RB IN DT NN IN DT NN NN IN JJ NN MD RB VB . ''
On the other hand , the report thinks the news might not be so bad for the North Atlantic fisheries .	IN DT JJ NN , DT NN VBZ DT NN MD RB VB RB JJ IN DT NNP NNP NNS .
" The impact of global warming on fish stocks and fisheries is hard to judge , " the IPN report said .	`` DT NN IN JJ NN IN NN NNS CC NNS VBZ JJ TO VB , '' DT NNP NN VBD .
" A warming of the magnitude predicted is more likely than not to be beneficial to the fisheries of the North Atlantic . "	`` DT NN IN DT NN VBN VBZ RBR JJ IN RB TO VB JJ IN DT NNS IN DT NNP NNP . ''
The important commercial species that probably would benefit from warming include cod , haddock , saithe , herring , blue whiting and several types of flatfish and crustaceans -- such as the Norway lobster .	DT JJ JJ NNS WDT RB MD VB IN NN VBP NN , NN , NN , NN , JJ NN CC JJ NNS IN NNS CC NNS , JJ IN DT NNP NN .
Important species that probably would decline include shrimp , capelin , Greenland halibut and some varieties of flatfish .	JJ NNS WDT RB MD VB VBP NNS , NN , NNP NN CC DT NNS IN NNS .
Hidden in this laundry list -- and in the pile of studies examined by the Pew researchers -- is one of the fundamental chasms dividing participants in the global warming debate .	VBN IN DT NN NN , CC IN DT NN IN NNS VBN IN DT NNP NNS , VBZ CD IN DT JJ NNS VBG NNS IN DT JJ NN NN .
The IPN report examines commercial fish species , but it neglects important non-commercial animals , such as seals and polar bears .	DT NNP NN VBZ JJ NN NNS , CC PRP VBZ JJ JJ NNS , JJ IN NNS CC JJ NNS .
In a limited economic sense , therefore , the organization can argue warming might be a good thing .	IN DT JJ JJ NN , RB , DT NN MD VB NN MD VB DT JJ NN .
The problem is whether one cares what happens to the polar bears , checkerspot butterflies and other unconsumables .	DT NN VBZ IN PRP VBZ WP VBZ IN DT JJ NNS , NN NNS CC JJ NNS .
The Pew researchers tried to transcend the economic argument .	DT NNP NNS VBD TO VB DT JJ NN .
They assumed a value -- unspecified -- for non-commercial species , and in doing so rendered the warming news a bit less rosy .	PRP VBD DT NN , JJ , IN JJ NNS , CC IN VBG RB VBD DT NN NN DT NN RBR JJ .
This tug - of - war over calculating economic values is the one that ultimately will have to be decided by humans , because animals and plants can adjust only so much .	DT NN HYPH IN HYPH NN IN VBG JJ NNS VBZ DT NN WDT RB MD VB TO VB VBN IN NNS , IN NNS CC NNS MD VB RB RB RB .
" When dandelions have set the mark of May on Wisconsin pastures , it is time to listen for the final proof of spring , " wrote Aldo Leopold in " A Sand County Almanac . "	`` WRB NNS VBP VBN DT NN IN NNP IN NNP NNS , PRP VBZ NN TO VB IN DT JJ NN IN NN , '' VBD NNP NNP IN `` DT NNP NNP NNP . ''

1 . Blowback in Iraq	LS . NN IN NNP

3 . The Syrian Connection	LS . DT JJ NN

The Syrian Air Force is comprised of ten to eleven fighter / attack squadrons and sixteen fighter squadrons , totaling somewhere near 650 aircraft .	DT JJ NNP NNP VBZ VBN IN CD IN CD NN HYPH NN NNS CC CD NN NNS , VBG RB IN CD NN .
Syria also possesses one of the largest arsenals of ballistic missiles in the region , comprised primarily of SCUD - derived systems .	NNP RB VBZ CD IN DT JJS NNS IN JJ NNS IN DT NN , VBN RB IN NNP HYPH VBN NNS .
Iran , North Korea and China have been willing providers of state - of - the - art technologies .	NNP , NNP NNP CC NNP VBP VBN JJ NNS IN NN HYPH IN HYPH DT HYPH NN NNS .
Compounding this is the well - based suspicion that Syria has perhaps the most advanced chemical weapons capability in the Persian Gulf .	VBG DT VBZ DT RB HYPH VBN NN IN NNP VBZ RB DT RBS JJ JJ NNS NN IN DT NNP NNP .
4 . China and the US Economy	LS . NNP CC DT NNP NN
While the ominous possibilities of heightened Iraqi chaos , missiles in the Gulf , and Syrian involvement loom large if the US attacks Iran , all pale in comparison to the involvement of China in any US / Iran engagement .	IN DT JJ NNS IN VBN JJ NN , NNS IN DT NN , CC JJ NN VBP JJ IN DT NNP VBZ NNP , DT VBP IN NN IN DT NN IN NNP IN DT NNP HYPH NNP NN .
China 's economy is exploding , hampered only by their great thirst for petroleum and natural gas to fuel their industry .	NNP POS NN VBZ VBG , VBN RB IN PRP$ JJ NN IN NN CC JJ NN TO VB PRP$ NN .
In the last several months , China has inked deals with Iran for $ 70 billion dollars worth of Iranian oil and natural gas .	IN DT JJ JJ NNS , NNP VBZ VBN NNS IN NNP IN $ CD CD NNS NN IN JJ NN CC JJ NN .
China will purchase 250 million tons of liquefied natural gas from Iran over the next 30 years , will develop the massive Yadavaran oil field in Iran , and will receive 150,000 barrels of oil per day from that field .	NNP MD VB CD CD NNS IN VBN JJ NN IN NNP IN DT JJ CD NNS , MD VB DT JJ NNP NN NN IN NNP , CC MD VB CD NNS IN NN IN NN IN DT NN .
China is seeking the construction of a pipeline from Iran to the Caspian Sea , where it would link with another planned pipeline running from Kazakhstan to China .	NNP VBZ VBG DT NN IN DT NN IN NNP IN DT NNP NNP , WRB PRP MD VB IN DT VBN NN VBG IN NNP IN NNP .
Any US attack on Iran could be perceived by China as a direct threat to its economic health .	DT NNP NN IN NNP MD VB VBN IN NNP IN DT JJ NN IN PRP$ JJ NN .
Further , any fighting in the Persian Gulf would imperil the tankers running China 's liquefied natural gas through the Strait of Hormuz .	RB , DT NN IN DT NNP NNP MD VB DT NNS VBG NNP POS VBN JJ NN IN DT NNP IN NNP .
Should China decide to retaliate against the US to defend its oil and natural gas deal with Iran , the US would be faced with a significant threat .	MD NNP VB TO VB IN DT NNP TO VB PRP$ NN CC JJ NN NN IN NNP , DT NNP MD VB VBN IN DT JJ NN .
This threat exists not merely on a military level , though China could force a confrontation in the Pacific by way of Taiwan .	DT NN VBZ RB RB IN DT JJ NN , IN NNP MD VB DT NN IN DT NNP IN NN IN NNP .
More significantly , China holds a large portion of the American economy in the palm of its hand .	RBR RB , NNP VBZ DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NN IN DT NN IN PRP$ NN .
Paul Craig Roberts , writing for The American Conservative , said in July of 2005 that " As a result of many years of persistent trade surpluses with the United States , the Japanese government holds dollar reserves of approximately $ 1 trillion .	NNP NNP NNPS , VBG IN DT NNP NNP , VBD IN NNP IN CD IN `` IN DT NN IN JJ NNS IN JJ NN NNS IN DT NNP NNP , DT JJ NN VBZ NN NNS IN RB $ CD CD .
China 's accumulation of dollars is approximately $ 600 billion .	NNP POS NN IN NNS VBZ RB $ CD CD .
South Korea holds about $ 200 billion .	NNP NNP VBZ RB $ CD CD .
These sums give these countries enormous leverage over the United States .	DT NNS VBP DT NNS JJ NN IN DT NNP NNP .
By dumping some portion of their reserves , these countries could put the dollar under intense pressure and send U.S. interest rates skyrocketing .	IN VBG DT NN IN PRP$ NNS , DT NNS MD VB DT NN IN JJ NN CC VB NNP NN NNS VBG .
Washington would really have to anger Japan and Korea to provoke such action , but in a showdown with China - over Taiwan , for example - China holds the cards .	NNP MD RB VB TO VB NNP CC NNP TO VB JJ NN , CC IN DT NN IN NNP , IN NNP , IN NN , NNP VBZ DT NNS .
China and Japan , and the world at large , have more dollar reserves than they require .	NNP CC NNP , CC DT NN IN JJ , VBP JJR NN NNS IN PRP VBP .
They would have no problem teaching a hegemonic superpower a lesson if the need arose . "	PRP MD VB DT NN VBG DT JJ NN DT NN IN DT NN VBD . ''
" The hardest blow on Americans , " concluded Roberts , " will fall when China does revalue its currency .	`` DT JJS NN IN NNPS , '' VBD NNP , `` MD VB WRB NNP VBZ VB PRP$ NN .
When China 's currency ceases to be undervalued , American shoppers in Wal - Mart , where 70 percent of the goods on the shelves are made in China , will think they are in Neiman Marcus .	WRB NNP POS NN VBZ TO VB VBN , JJ NNS IN NNP , NNP , WRB CD NN IN DT NNS IN DT NNS VBP VBN IN NNP , MD VB PRP VBP IN NNP NNP .
Price increases will cause a dramatic reduction in American real incomes .	NN NNS MD VB DT JJ NN IN JJ JJ NNS .
If this coincides with rising interest rates and a setback in the housing market , American consumers will experience the hardest times since the Great Depression . "	IN DT VBZ IN VBG NN NNS CC DT NN IN DT NN NN , JJ NNS MD VB DT JJS NNS IN DT NNP NNP . ''
In short , China has the American economy by the throat .	IN JJ , NNP VBZ DT JJ NN IN DT NN .
Should they decide to squeeze , we will all feel it .	MD PRP VB TO VB , PRP MD RB VB PRP .
China 's strong hand in this even extends to the diplomatic realm ; China is a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council , and could veto any actions against Iran proposed by the United States . 5 . American Preparedness	LS . JJ NN
American citizens have for decades taken it as a given that our military can overwhelm and overcome any foe on the battlefield .	JJ NNS VBP IN NNS VBN PRP IN DT NN IN PRP$ NN MD VB CC VB DT NN IN DT NN .
The rapid victory during the first Gulf War cemented this perception .	DT JJ NN IN DT JJ NNP NNP VBD DT NN .
The last three years of the Iraq occupation , however , have sapped this confidence .	DT JJ CD NNS IN DT NNP NN , RB , VBP VBN DT NN .
Worse , the occupation has done great damage to the strength of the American military , justifying the decrease in confidence .	RBR , DT NN VBZ VBN JJ NN IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN , VBG DT NN IN NN .
Thanks to repeated deployments to Iraq and Afghanistan , recruiting is at an all - time low .	NN IN VBN NNS IN NNP CC NNP , NN VBZ IN DT DT HYPH NN NN .
Soldiers with vital training and know - how are refusing to re-enlist .	NNS IN JJ NN CC NN HYPH NN VBP VBG TO VB .
Across the board , the American military is stretched to the breaking point .	IN DT NN , DT JJ NN VBZ VBN IN DT NN NN .
Two vaunted economists - one a Nobel Prize winner and the other a nationally renowned budget expert - have analyzed the data at hand and put a price tag on the Iraq occupation .	CD JJ NNS , CD DT NNP NNP NN CC DT JJ DT RB JJ NN NN , VBP VBN DT NN IN NN CC VBN DT NN NN IN DT NNP NN .
According to Linda Bilmes of Harvard and Nobel Laureate Joseph E. Stiglitz of Columbia University , the final cost of the Iraq occupation will run between $ 1 trillion and $ 2 trillion , surpassing by orders of magnitude the estimates put forth by the Bush administration .	VBG IN NNP NNP IN NNP CC NNP NNP NNP NNP NNP IN NNP NNP , DT JJ NN IN DT NNP NN MD VB IN $ CD CD CC $ CD CD , VBG IN NNS IN NN DT NNS VBN RB IN DT NNP NN .
If an engagement with Iran envelops our forces in Iraq , and comes to involve Syria , our economy will likely shatter under the strain of fighting so many countries simultaneously .	IN DT NN IN NNP VBZ PRP$ NNS IN NNP , CC VBZ TO VB NNP , PRP$ NN MD RB VB IN DT NN IN VBG RB JJ NNS RB .
Add to this the economic threat posed by China , and the economic threat implicit in any substantial disruption of the distribution of Mideast petroleum to the globe .	VB IN DT DT JJ NN VBN IN NNP , CC DT JJ NN JJ IN DT JJ NN IN DT NN IN NNP NN IN DT NN .
If Iran and Syria - with their significant armaments , missile technologies and suspected chemical weapons capabilities - decide to engage with the relatively undersized US force in Iraq , our troops there will be fish in a barrel .	IN NNP CC NNP , IN PRP$ JJ NNS , NN NNS CC VBN JJ NNS NNS , VBP TO VB IN DT RB JJ NNP NN IN NNP , PRP$ NNS RB MD VB NNS IN DT NN .
Iran 's position over the Gulf would make resupply by ship and air support from carriers a dangerous affair .	NNP POS NN IN DT NN MD VB NN IN NN CC NN NN IN NNS DT JJ NN .
In the worst - case scenario , the newly - minted American order of battle requiring the use of nuclear weapons to rescue a surrounded and imperiled force could come into play , hurling the entire planet into military and diplomatic bedlam .	IN DT JJS HYPH NN NN , DT RB HYPH VBN JJ NN IN NN VBG DT NN IN JJ NNS TO VB DT VBN CC VBN NN MD VB IN NN , VBG DT JJ NN IN JJ CC JJ NN .
Conclusion : Is Any of This Possible ?	NN : VBZ DT IN DT JJ .
The question must be put as directly as possible : what manner of maniac would undertake a path so fraught with peril and potential economic catastrophe ?	DT NN MD VB VBN RB RB IN JJ , WDT NN IN NN MD VB DT NN RB JJ IN NN CC JJ JJ NN .
It is difficult to imagine a justification for any action that could envelop the United States in a military and economic conflict with Iraq , Iran , Syria and China simultaneously .	PRP VBZ JJ TO VB DT NN IN DT NN WDT MD VB DT NNP NNP IN DT JJ CC JJ NN IN NNP , NNP , NNP CC NNP RB .
Iran is suspected by many nations of working towards the development of nuclear weapons , but even this justification has been tossed into a cocked hat .	NNP VBZ VBN IN JJ NNS IN VBG IN DT NN IN JJ NNS , CC RB DT NN VBZ VBN VBN IN DT JJ NN .
Recently , Russian president Vladimir Putin bluntly stated that Iran is not developing its nuclear capability for any reasons beyond peaceful energy creation , and pledged to continue assisting Iran in this endeavor .	RB , JJ NN NNP NNP RB VBD IN NNP VBZ RB VBG PRP$ JJ NN IN DT NNS IN JJ NN NN , CC VBD TO VB VBG NNP IN DT NN .
Therefore , any attack upon Iran 's nuclear facilities will bring Russia into the mess .	RB , DT NN IN NNP POS JJ NNS MD VB NNP IN DT NN .
Iran also stands accused of aiding terrorism across the globe .	NNP RB VBZ VBN IN VBG NN IN DT NN .
The dangers implicit in any attack upon that nation , however , seem to significantly offset whatever gains could be made in the so - called " War on Terror . "	DT NNS JJ IN DT NN IN DT NN , RB , VBP TO RB VB WDT NNS MD VB VBN IN DT RB HYPH VBN `` NN IN NN . ''
Unfortunately , all the dangers in the world are no match for the self - assurance of a bubble - encased zealot .	RB , PDT DT NNS IN DT NN VBP DT NN IN DT NN HYPH NN IN DT NN HYPH VBN NN .
What manner of maniac would undertake such a dangerous course ?	WDT NN IN NN MD VB PDT DT JJ NN .
Look no further than 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue .	VB RB RBR IN CD NNP NNP .
George W. Bush and his administration have consistently undertaken incredibly dangerous courses of action in order to garner political power on the home front .	NNP NNP NNP CC PRP$ NN VBP RB VBN RB JJ NNS IN NN IN NN TO VB JJ NN IN DT NN NN .
Recall the multiple terror threats lobbed out by the administration whenever damaging political news appeared in the media .	VB DT JJ NN NNS VBN RB IN DT NN WRB JJ JJ NN VBD IN DT NN .
More significantly , recall Iraq .	RBR RB , VB NNP .
Karl Rove , Bush 's most senior advisor , notoriously told Republicans on the ballot during the 2002 midterms to " run on the war . "	NNP NNP , NNP POS RBS JJ NN , RB VBD NNPS IN DT NN IN DT CD NNS TO `` VB IN DT NN . ''
The invasion of Iraq provided marvelous political cover for the GOP not only during those midterms , but during the 2004 Presidential election .	DT NN IN NNP VBD JJ JJ NN IN DT NNP RB RB IN DT NNS , CC IN DT CD JJ NN .
What kind of political cover would be gained from an attack on Iran , and from the diversion of attention to that attack ?	WDT NN IN JJ NN MD VB VBN IN DT NN IN NNP , CC IN DT NN IN NN IN DT NN .
The answer lies in one now - familiar name : Jack Abramoff .	DT NN VBZ IN CD RB HYPH JJ NN : NNP NNP .
The Abramoff scandal threatens to subsume all the hard - fought GOP gains in Congress , and the 2006 midterms are less than a year away .	DT NNP NN VBZ TO VB PDT DT RB HYPH VBN NNP NNS IN NNP , CC DT CD NNS VBP JJR IN DT NN RB .
Is any of this a probability ?	VBZ DT IN DT DT NN .
Logic says no , but logic seldom plays any part in modern American politics .	NN VBZ UH , CC NN RB VBZ DT NN IN JJ JJ NNS .

They did it once already in Iraq .	PRP VBD PRP RB RB IN NNP .

what is a kimberwick bit used for ?	WP VBZ DT NN NN VBN IN .
Used as a help for horses that are quite strong pullers while hacking , hunting and doing cross country .	VBN IN DT NN IN NNS WDT VBP RB JJ NNS IN VBG , VBG CC VBG NN NN .
It is a curb bit with a ported mouth piece and some horses appreciate this to give them more room in their mouths for their tongues .	PRP VBZ DT NN NN IN DT JJ NN NN CC DT NNS VBP DT TO VB PRP JJR NN IN PRP$ NNS IN PRP$ NNS .
It is not as precise as a pelham bit because it only uses one rein , though the modern ones have two or three slots on which to put the reins .	PRP VBZ RB RB JJ IN DT NN NN IN PRP RB VBZ CD NN , IN DT JJ NNS VBP CD CC CD NNS IN WDT TO VB DT NNS .
The lower the reins , the stronger the action and the lower the reins the stronger the action on the poll too .	DT JJR DT NNS , DT JJR DT NN CC DT JJR DT NNS DT JJR DT NN IN DT NN RB .
Useful for younger kids who do not have big enough hands or the ability to handle two reins independently .	JJ IN JJR NNS WP VBP RB VB JJ RB NNS CC DT NN TO VB CD NNS RB .
For horses that are strong pullers .	IN NNS WDT VBP JJ NNS .
It just gives you a little leverage and curb pressure .	PRP RB VBZ PRP DT JJ NN CC NN NN .
It 's nice for horses that need a little more than a snaffle .	PRP VBZ JJ IN NNS WDT VBP DT JJ JJR IN DT NN .
I know that 's vague , but it depends on the horse .	PRP VBP DT VBZ JJ , CC PRP VBZ IN DT NN .
The rider needs to have independent hands as well , because you do NOT want to pull too hard on a bit like that . ;)	DT NN VBZ TO VB JJ NNS RB RB , IN PRP VBP RB VB TO VB RB RB IN DT NN IN DT . NFP

does the POP drying time slow down if it not exposed to air ?	VBZ DT NN NN NN VB RP IN PRP RB VBN IN NN .
it s for a craft project ..... i want to use it the way u would use icing ....	PRP VBZ IN DT NN NN , PRP VBP TO VB PRP DT NN PRP MD VB NN .
took a bit of searching to discover that POP is probably PoP - plaster of Paris and yes plaster of Paris will slow way down if it is not exposed to air - in fact , if you are building up plaster ( " the way you would icing " ) to do sculpting , which is rather uncommon , you keep the set plaster damp in order to add more unset plaster or you have to wet the area where you will be adding plaster " mud "	VBD DT NN IN NN TO VB IN NN VBZ RB NN , NN IN NNP CC UH NN IN NNP MD VB RB RB IN PRP VBZ RB VBN IN NN , IN NN , IN PRP VBP VBG RP NN -LRB- `` DT NN PRP MD NN '' -RRB- TO VB NN , WDT VBZ RB JJ , PRP VBP DT JJ NN JJ IN NN TO VB JJR JJ NN CC PRP VBP TO VB DT NN WRB PRP MD VB VBG NN `` NN ''
Plaster of Paris does two things	NN IN NNP VBZ CD NNS
- it chemically sets - gets warm to hot then cools down and hard and	, PRP RB VBZ , VBZ JJ IN JJ RB VBZ RP CC JJ CC
- it dries out , losing the water that is soaked into the set structure	, PRP VBZ RP , VBG DT NN WDT VBZ VBN IN DT JJ NN
For example , a set plaster mold that is to be used for clay slip casting must be dry - it gets wet pulling the water out of the slip - while a set plaster mold used for molding wax must be soaking or damp wet http://www.mikegigi.com/castgobl.htm#LGGOBPROJ	IN NN , DT JJ NN NN WDT VBZ TO VB VBN IN NN NN NN MD VB JJ , PRP VBZ JJ VBG DT NN IN IN DT NN , IN DT JJ NN NN VBN IN NN NN MD VB JJ CC JJ JJ ADD

turn the modem off and see if the sound is still there ... could be static on the line ... if the sound is still there with the modem off then the problem is NOT the DSL ....	VB DT NN RP CC VB IN DT NN VBZ RB RB , MD VB NN IN DT NN , IN DT NN VBZ RB RB IN DT NN RB RB DT NN VBZ RB DT NN .
if the trouble goes away with the modem off , then make sure that EVERYTHING EXCEPT the modem is filtered , this would include the alarm system , fax machine , satellite boxes , phones , etc ... It 's light proof and makes sure you get no problems when opening the camera .	PRP VBZ NN JJ CC VBZ JJ PRP VBP DT NNS WRB VBG DT NN .

A changing bag folds neatly and does not take much space in your bag .	DT NN NN VBZ RB CC VBZ RB VB JJ NN IN PRP$ NN .

Question about the sinking of the Titanic ?	NN IN DT NN IN DT NNP .
After the sinking of the Titanic in 1912 , was there a law made so that ships would carry enough lifeboats to save everybody on a ship if it was sinking ?	IN DT NN IN DT NNP IN CD , VBD EX DT NN VBN IN IN NNS MD VB JJ NNS TO VB NN IN DT NN IN PRP VBD VBG .
If yes , was Canada involved in this act / law ?	IN UH , VBD NNP JJ IN DT NN , NN .
Sorry , I 'm just very nervous after watching the movie .	UH , PRP VBP RB RB JJ IN VBG DT NN .
SOLAS ( Safety Of Life At Sea ) , which is an international maritime treaty , came about in response to the tragedy of the Titanic .	NNP -LRB- NNP IN NNP IN NNP -RRB- , WDT VBZ DT JJ JJ NN , VBD RB IN NN IN DT NN IN DT NNP .
Today , it is the primary safety law affecting virtually all ships , regardless of country of registration .	NN , PRP VBZ DT JJ NN NN VBG RB DT NNS , RB IN NN IN NN .
If you ever go on a cruise ship , you will be required to attend a SOLAS muster drill ( lifeboat drill ) within 24 hours of sailing .	IN PRP RB VBP IN DT NN NN , PRP MD VB VBN TO VB DT NNP NN NN -LRB- NN NN -RRB- IN CD NNS IN NN .
Most ships perform this drill before even leaving the dock .	JJS NNS VBP DT NN IN RB VBG DT NN .
SOLAS covers just about every aspect of safety at sea , including minimum safety equipment , practices , and standards , lifeboats , navigation practices , fire protection , and so on .	NNP VBZ RB RB DT NN IN NN IN NN , VBG JJ NN NN , NNS , CC NNS , NNS , NN NNS , NN NN , CC RB RB .
We are much safer today on board ship due to SOLAS , and I suppose if any good came out of the Titanic tragedy , the adoption of SOLAS is probably it .	PRP VBP RB JJR NN IN IN NN IN IN NNP , CC PRP VBP IN DT JJ VBD IN IN DT NNP NN , DT NN IN NNP VBZ RB PRP .
http://www.caribbean-cruising.net	ADD
--------------------------------------------------	NFP
Edit : Also I forgot to mention earlier , most ( if not all ) cruise ships also practice lifeboat drills weekly , and it is not uncommon to see them to actually launch the lifeboats into the water as part of their drill when you are in port .	NN : RB PRP VBD TO VB RB , JJS -LRB- IN RB DT -RRB- NN NNS RB VBP NN NNS RB , CC PRP VBZ RB JJ TO VB PRP TO RB VB DT NNS IN DT NN IN NN IN PRP$ NN WRB PRP VBP IN NN .
This not only ensures the lifeboats are operational and will work if needed , but makes the crew proficient at launching them .	DT RB RB VBZ DT NNS VBP JJ CC MD VB IN VBN , CC VBZ DT NN JJ IN VBG PRP .

To save money Robert McNamara ordered that the ammunition for the new M - 16s being sent to SEA in the early 60s use an older ( dirtier ) type of gunpowder meant for use with the M - 14 .	TO VB NN NNP NNP VBD IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN HYPH NNS VBG VBN IN NN IN DT JJ NNS VBP DT JJR -LRB- JJR -RRB- NN IN NN VBN IN NN IN DT NN HYPH CD .
He also ordered that the receiver not get a ( I think chrome ) coating that helped keep the gun from jamming .	PRP RB VBD IN DT NN RB VB DT -LRB- PRP VBP NN -RRB- NN WDT VBD VB DT NN IN VBG .
Than the troops being issued the weapon were told it was self - cleaning , which it was n't .	RB DT NNS VBG VBN DT NN VBD VBN PRP VBD NN HYPH VBG , WDT PRP VBD RB .
As a result there was a problem with the weapon jamming .	IN DT NN EX VBD DT NN IN DT NN VBG .
Once the troops started cleaning the weapon properly ( even with the dirtier powder ) the Vietnam era M - 16 turned out to be a good weapon for the purpose it was being used for .	IN DT NNS VBD VBG DT NN RB -LRB- RB IN DT JJR NN -RRB- DT NNP NNP NN HYPH CD VBD RP TO VB DT JJ NN IN DT NN PRP VBD VBG VBN IN .
The screw - up was the kind of things you have happen when you have bean - counters ( and McNamara was nothing if not a bean - counter ) instead of soldiers in charge of the military . Where in the world is Iguazu ?	WRB IN DT NN VBZ NNP .
Iguazu Falls	NNP NNPS
Widely considered to be one of the most spectacular waterfalls in the world , the Iguazu Falls on the border of Argentina and Brazil , are a certainly must see attraction in the area .	RB VBN TO VB CD IN DT RBS JJ NNS IN DT NN , DT NNP NNPS IN DT NN IN NNP CC NNP , VBP DT RB MD VB NN IN DT NN .
The centre of the falls is known locally as ‘ Garganta Del Diablo ’ ( The Devil ’s Throat ) , where the huge volume of water sends a constant mist of spray into the air .	DT NN IN DT NN VBZ VBN RB IN `` NNP NNP NNP '' -LRB- DT NNP POS NNP -RRB- , WRB DT JJ NN IN NN VBZ DT JJ NN IN NN IN DT NN .
With the sun shinning down on the spray , creating a rainbow in the foreground , this is the perfect place to get that trademark Iguazu Falls photograph .	IN DT NN VBG RB IN DT NN , VBG DT NN IN DT NN , DT VBZ DT JJ NN TO VB DT NN NNP NNPS NN .
However , save some of your shots for the rest of the falls , as in total there are around 270 cascades that spread out over nearly 2 miles of the Iguazu River .	RB , VB DT IN PRP$ NNS IN DT NN IN DT NNS , IN IN JJ EX VBP RB CD NNS WDT VBP RB IN RB CD NNS IN DT NNP NNP .
The Iguazu Falls are easily accessible and , dependent on your time restrictions and budget , you can get to the area by either bus or plane .	DT NNP NNPS VBP RB JJ CC , JJ IN PRP$ NN NNS CC NN , PRP MD VB IN DT NN IN CC NN CC NN .
The nearest towns to the site are Puerto Iguazu in Argentina , about 12 miles from the falls , and Foz do Iguaçu in Brazil , which is equally close .	DT JJS NNS IN DT NN VBP NNP NNP IN NNP , RB CD NNS IN DT NN , CC NNP NNP NNP IN NNP , WDT VBZ RB JJ .
Both towns have airports that are served regularly from the larger cities such as Sao Paulo , Rio de Janeiro and Buenos Aires .	DT NNS VBP NNS WDT VBP VBN RB IN DT JJR NNS JJ IN NNP NNP , NNP NNP NNP CC NNP NNP .
The bus is obviously the cheaper option , and travelling up from Buenos Aires the trip is a full 20 hours , although the buses are very comfortable with spacious reclining seats .	DT NN VBZ RB DT JJR NN , CC VBG RB IN NNP NNP DT NN VBZ DT JJ CD NNS , IN DT NNS VBP RB JJ IN JJ VBG NNS .
The bus trip down from Sao Paulo is a similar affair taking around 18 hours .	DT NN NN RB IN NNP NNP VBZ DT JJ NN VBG RB CD NNS .
Foz on the Brazilian side is the larger town , however both are geared up to cater for visitors to the Waterfalls and National Parks , and so offer a range of accommodation for all budgets . What is Italian High Renaissance ?	WP VBZ JJ JJ NNP .
Have a look at this , it may help .	VB DT NN IN DT , PRP MD VB .
1 ) The Italian Renaissance began the opening phase of the Renaissance , a period of great cultural change and achievement in Europe that spanned the period from the end of the 13th century to about 1600 , marking the transition between Medieval and Early Modern Europe .	LS -RRB- DT NNP NNP VBD DT JJ NN IN DT NNP , DT NN IN JJ JJ NN CC NN IN NNP WDT VBD DT NN IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN IN RB CD , VBG DT NN IN JJ CC JJ JJ NNP .
The term renaissance is in essence a modern one that came into currency in the 19th century , in the work of historians such as Jacob Burckhardt .	DT NN NNP VBZ IN NN DT JJ NN WDT VBD IN NN IN DT JJ NN , IN DT NN IN NNS JJ IN NNP NNP .
Although the origins of a movement that was confined largely to the literate culture of intellectual endeavor and patronage can be traced to the earlier part of the 14th century , many aspects of Italian culture and society remained largely Medieval ; the Renaissance did not come into full swing until the end of the century .	IN DT NNS IN DT NN WDT VBD VBN RB IN DT JJ NN IN JJ NN CC NN MD VB VBN IN DT JJR NN IN DT JJ NN , JJ NNS IN JJ NN CC NN VBD RB JJ , DT NNP VBD RB VB IN JJ NN IN DT NN IN DT NN .
The word renaissance ( Rinascimento in Italian ) means “ rebirth ” , and the era is best known for the renewed interest in the culture of classical antiquity after the period that Renaissance humanists labelled the Dark Ages .	DT NN NNP -LRB- NNP IN NNP -RRB- VBZ `` NN '' , CC DT NN VBZ RBS VBN IN DT VBN NN IN DT NN IN JJ NN IN DT NN WDT NNP NNS VBD DT NNP NNPS .
These changes , while significant , were concentrated in the elite , and for the vast majority of the population life was little changed from the Middle Ages .	DT NNS , IN JJ , VBD VBN IN DT JJ , CC IN DT JJ NN IN DT NN NN VBD RB VBN IN DT NNP NNPS .
2 ) The expression High Renaissance , in art history , is a periodizing convention used to denote the apogee of the visual arts in the Italian Renaissance .	LS -RRB- DT NN JJ NNP , IN NN NN , VBZ DT NN NN VBN TO VB DT NN IN DT JJ NNS IN DT JJ NNP .
The High Renaissance period is traditionally taken to begin in the 1490s , with Leonardo s fresco of the Last Supper in Milan and the death of Lorenzo de' Medici in Florence , and to have ended in 1527 with the sacking of Rome by the troops of Charles V .	DT JJ NNP NN VBZ RB VBN TO VB IN DT NNS , IN NNP POS NN IN DT NNP NNP IN NNP CC DT NN IN NNP NNP NNP IN NNP , CC TO VB VBN IN CD IN DT NN IN NNP IN DT NNS IN NNP NNP .
This term was first used in German ( Hochrenaissance ) in the early nineteenth century , and has its origins in the " High Style " of painting and sculpture described by Johann Joachim Winckelmann . A Sussex crossed with Silkie would make a crossbred * mutt * chicken .	DT NN VBN IN NN MD VB DT VBN NFP NN NFP NNS .
There are a lot of genetics at play between a Sussex and Silkie , so the offspring would vary in appearance .	EX VBP DT NN IN NNS IN NN IN DT NN CC NN , RB DT NN MD VB IN NN .
You do n't say what color Silkie or Sussex you are dealing with so I ca n't say what color your chicks would be likely to be .	PRP VBP RB VB WDT NN NN CC NN PRP VBP VBG IN RB PRP MD RB VB WDT NN PRP$ NNS MD VB JJ TO VB .
However , I can say what features they would / could have .	RB , PRP MD VB WDT NNS PRP MD , MD VB .
Feather Type .	NN NN .
Silkies have hookless feathers .	NNS VBP JJ NNS .
Sussexs have soft feathers .	NNS VBP JJ NNS .
All offspring from this cross will have soft feathers , as hookless feathers are a recessive gene .	DT NN IN DT NN MD VB JJ NNS , IN JJ NNS VBP DT JJ NN .
Skin Color : Silkies have black skin color , which is dominate .	NN NNP : NNS VBP JJ NN NN , WDT VBZ JJ .
Sussex have White Skin which could be recessive or dominate .	NN VBP JJ NN WDT MD VB JJ CC JJ .
Either way rec. and dom. white genes dilute the black gene .	DT NN JJ CC JJ JJ NNS VBP DT JJ NN .
Skin will be darker but lighter then the Silkies .	NN MD VB JJR CC JJR IN DT NNS .
Beards / Muffs : If your Silkie has a beard / muff the offspring could have a beard as well , as these genes are incomplete dominate .	NNS , NNS : IN PRP$ NN VBZ DT NN , NN DT NN MD VB DT NN RB RB , IN DT NNS VBP RB JJ .
Feathered Feet / Shanks - Chicks could have feathered feet / shanks as this is also incomplete dominate .	JJ NNS , NNS : NNS MD VB JJ NNS , NNS IN DT VBZ RB RB JJ .
Crest : Chicks could also develop a small crest due to this being another incomplete dominate gene .	NN : NNS MD RB VB DT JJ NN IN IN DT VBG DT RB JJ NN .
Comb Type : Silkies have walnut combs which is actually genetically two comb types ( Rose and Pea ) single is also there , but is recessive .	NN NN : NNS VBP NN NNS WDT VBZ RB RB CD NN NNS -LRB- NN CC NN -RRB- NN VBZ RB RB , CC VBZ JJ .
So crossed to a Sussex you could get a walnut , pea , rose , or single combed bird .	RB VBN IN DT NNP PRP MD VB DT NN , NN , NN , CC JJ VBN NN .
Five Toes : Silkies have five toes .	CD NNS : NNS VBP CD NNS .
Sussex have four toes .	NN VBP CD NNS .
Crossed together ( five toes is incompletely dominate ) chicks could develop to have an fifth toe on both , or even one foot .	VBN RB -LRB- CD NNS VBZ RB JJ -RRB- NNS MD VB TO VB DT JJ NN IN DT , CC RB CD NN .
Silkie crosses are great birds , and very neat looking .	NN NNS VBP JJ NNS , CC RB JJ VBG .

what are some unique customs in ireland ?	WP VBP DT JJ NNS IN NNP .
As far ask I ’m aware our most unique custom would be the “ Country Wake ” .	RB RB IN PRP VBP JJ PRP$ RBS JJ NN MD VB DT `` NN NN '' .
In all my travels I ’ve never seen anything like it and am often met with an odd look when I explain them to foreigners .	IN PDT PRP$ NNS PRP VBP RB VBN NN IN PRP CC VBP RB VBN IN DT JJ NN WRB PRP VBP PRP IN NNS .
After a person dies , their remains are “ waked ” in their home for roughly 2 - 3 days .	IN DT NN VBZ , PRP$ NNS VBP `` VBN `` IN PRP$ NN IN RB CD SYM CD NNS .
In this time visitors will come to the house , pay their respects to the desisted and their family and have a couple of cups of tea with a sandwich or a bun .	IN DT NN NNS MD VB IN DT NN , VB PRP$ NNS IN DT JJ CC PRP$ NN CC VBP DT NN IN NNS IN NN IN DT NN CC DT NN .
The wake also included the night sit were friends and family sit up through the night with the remains .	DT NN RB VBD DT NN NN WRB NNS CC NN VBP RP IN DT NN IN DT NNS .
Wakes are common both north and south of the boarder with Protestants and Catholics alike .	NNS VBP JJ CC RB CC RB IN DT NN IN NNPS CC NNPS RB .
But only really in the countryside .	CC RB RB IN DT NN .
The only notable difference I have noticed is that in the south of Ireland one night of the wake is often held in the chapel the night before the funeral , this tradition started after the civil war .	DT JJ JJ NN PRP VBP VBN VBZ IN IN DT NN IN NNP CD NN IN DT NN VBZ RB VBN IN DT NN DT NN IN DT NN , DT NN VBD IN DT JJ NN .
Another unique custom ( and a dying one at that ) is the Pioneers .	DT JJ NN -LRB- CC DT VBG NN IN DT -RRB- VBZ DT NNPS .
The Pioneers was an organization started at the end of the 19th century which pushed and supported the ideal of temperance ( abstaining from alcohol ) , in an attempt to deal with the massive issue of alcoholism that Ireland was gripped by .	DT NNPS VBD DT NN VBN IN DT NN IN DT JJ NN WDT VBD CC VBD DT NN IN NN -LRB- VBG IN RB -RRB- , IN DT NN TO VB IN DT JJ NN IN NN WDT NNP VBD VBN IN .

I my self am one but appreciate that the organization is unlikely to make into the 22nd century .	PRP GW PRP VBP CD CC VBP IN DT NN VBZ JJ TO VB IN DT JJ NN .
The Orange Order and the 12th of July Marches would be argued by some not to be an Irish custom but unarguable ticks every criteria to be considered one .	DT NNP NNP CC DT NN IN NNP NNPS MD VB VBN IN DT RB TO VB DT JJ NN CC RB VBZ DT NN TO VB VBN CD .

Do dogs enjoy watching T.V. ?	VBP NNS VB VBG NN .
Well , T.V. is a series of flickering pictures that are streamed together to make a moving picture .	UH , NN VBZ DT NN IN VBG NNS WDT VBP VBN RB TO VB DT VBG NN .
The pictures are broadcast at a rate of about 60 Hz , which is how fast they need to move for us to see them as a moving , flawless picture .	DT NNS VBP VBN IN DT NN IN RB CD NN , WDT VBZ WRB JJ PRP VBP TO VB IN PRP TO VB PRP IN DT VBG , JJ NN .

Was the San Francisco Bay Area mostly Caucasian back in the early 1970s ?	VBD DT NNP NNP NNP NNP RB JJ RB IN DT JJ NNS .
No .	UH .
There has been a large Asian presence in the SF Bay Area for a long time -- the Chinatown here was the largest population of chinese outside of China , there were lots of Japanese who 'd been displaced during WWII .	EX VBZ VBN DT JJ JJ NN IN DT NNP NNP NNP IN DT JJ NN : DT NNP RB VBD DT JJS NN IN NNPS RB IN NNP , EX VBD NNS IN JJ WP VBD VBN VBN IN NNP .
The whole Western Addition and a large portion of the Haight was black .	DT JJ NNP NNP CC DT JJ NN IN DT NNP VBD JJ .
The Mission was basically latin - american .	DT NNP VBD RB JJ HYPH JJ .
As the southeast asians and philipinos came over , they added to the cultures .	IN DT NNP NNPS CC NNPS VBD RB , PRP VBD IN DT NNS .
So , the Bay Area has been fairly mixed ethnically for a long time -- caucasians may have seemed to be a large populous but that 's because most tourists back then were caucasian and many of the hippies were caucasians so that 's who the photographers took pictures of . How could we make it settle in a new house .	WRB MD PRP VB PRP VB IN DT JJ NN .
you are not just moving house - your cat is losing his territory .	PRP VBP RB RB VBG NN , PRP$ NN VBZ VBG PRP$ NN .
territory is very important to cats , and they are very nervous when they go into a new place - a new house could be full of predators , or unknown menaces - well at least he thinks so .	NN VBZ RB JJ IN NNS , CC PRP VBP RB JJ WRB PRP VBP IN DT JJ NN , DT JJ NN MD VB JJ IN NNS , CC JJ NNS , UH RB RBS PRP VBZ RB .

then , he can have a place to retreat to when he feels scared .	RB , PRP MD VB DT NN TO VB IN WRB PRP VBZ JJ .
you will need to get his box and bowls , and whatever blanket and toys are his , and smell like home , and put him in a room .	PRP MD VB TO VB PRP$ NN CC NNS , CC WDT NN CC NNS VBP PRP$ , CC VBP IN NN , CC VBD PRP IN DT NN .
the room you sleep in is best ( seeing you so relaxed that you are sleeping will send the message that everything is OK ) , but others will work just as well .	DT NN PRP VBP IN VBZ JJS -LRB- VBG PRP RB JJ IN PRP VBP VBG MD VB DT NN IN NN VBZ JJ -RRB- , CC NNS MD VB RB RB RB .

he will feel much safer in that one room , than in a huge unknown house .	PRP MD VB RB JJR IN DT CD NN , IN IN DT JJ JJ NN .
he will explore the room , mark everything with his cheek , and try to make it feel like his territory .	PRP MD VB DT NN , VB NN IN PRP$ NN , CC VB TO VB PRP VBD IN PRP$ NN .
he will reassure himself that no other animal is in there , and that no other animal will come in - he is afraid that he is in someone else 's territory when he is in a new house . then put him back in .	RB VB PRP RB RB .
he will be freaked out , so going back to his territory will make him much happier .	PRP MD VB VBN RP , RB VBG RB IN PRP$ NN MD VB PRP RB JJR .

Let me try to break this down as simply as I can : diurnal ( active during the day time ) reptiles like the bearded dragon require 3 types of " light , " UVA , UVB , and heat .	VB PRP VB TO VB DT RP RB RB IN PRP MD : JJ -LRB- JJ IN DT NN NN -RRB- NNS IN DT JJ NN VBP CD NNS IN `` NN , '' NN , NN , CC NN .
Any white light emitting light source will emit UVA , including heat bulbs , that 's the easy one to provide for .	DT NN NN VBG NN NN MD VB NN , VBG NN NNS , DT VBZ DT JJ NN TO VB IN .
UVB on the other hand can only be reproduced by a fluorescent source .	NN IN DT JJ NN MD RB VB VBN IN DT JJ NN .
UVB will always be a separate bulb from the heat lamp , unless you use a MVB ( mercury vapor bulb ) which is the only reptile use bulb that will emit both UVB and heat from one bulb .	NN MD RB VB DT JJ NN IN DT NN NN , IN PRP VBP DT NN -LRB- NN NN NN -RRB- WDT VBZ DT JJ NN NN NN WDT MD VB CC NN CC NN IN CD NN .
I highly recommend that you do not use coiled / compact UVB bulbs as they are known to cause severe eye damage and / or blindness in reptiles not to mention they have trouble maintaining UVB output over time .	PRP RB VBP IN PRP VBP RB VB JJ , JJ NN NNS IN PRP VBP VBN TO VB JJ NN NN CC , CC NN IN NNS RB TO VB PRP VBP NN VBG NN NN IN NN .
The long tube UVB bulbs are best , like Zoomed 's Repsitun model : http://lllreptile.com/store/catalog/reptile-supplies/uvb-fluorescent-lights-mercury-vapor-bulbs/-/zoo-med-24-repti-sun-100-fluorescent-bulb/ Remember to replace UVB bulbs according to the manufacturer s recommendation after which time the bulb will no longer produce UVB even if visible light still is .	DT JJ NN NN NNS VBP JJS , IN NNP POS NNP NN : ADD VB TO VB NN NNS VBG IN DT NN POS NN IN WDT NN DT NN MD RB RBR VB NN RB IN JJ NN RB VBZ .
So , to answer your question , no , if you just have a bulb that says it produces UVA then you do not have " the sun 's rays " that your bearded needs .	RB , TO VB PRP$ NN , UH , IN PRP RB VBP DT NN WDT VBZ PRP VBZ NNP RB PRP VBP RB VB `` DT NN POS NNS `` WDT PRP$ VBN VBZ .
You need to also provide a source a UVB lighting .	PRP VBP TO RB VB DT NN IN NNP NN .
The person at Petsmart is very wrong ; in fact it is always a good idea to second guess what most pet store employees tell you ; they do n't have the best track record regarding giving reliable pet care info .	DT NN IN NNP VBZ RB JJ , IN NN PRP VBZ RB DT JJ NN TO RB VB WP JJS NN NN NNS VBP PRP , PRP VBP RB VB DT JJS NN NN VBG VBG JJ NN NN NN .
UVB and basking temp ( should be about 110 F for a baby , 95 F for an adult ) should be available for 10 - 12 hours a day .	NNP CC VBG NN -LRB- MD VB RB CD NNP IN DT NN , CD NNP IN DT NN -RRB- MD VB JJ IN CD SYM CD NNS DT NN .
Freeze dried food is not a good staple food source ; you need to offer live feeder insects .	VB VBN NN VBZ RB DT JJ NN NN NN , PRP VBP TO VB JJ NN NNS .
Bearded dragons are sight hunters , they need to see the food move to trigger a feeding response , especially when they are babies .	JJ NNS VBP JJ NNS , PRP VBP TO VB DT NN VB TO VB DT VBG NN , RB WRB PRP VBP NNS .
Live food is also higher in nutritional value than freeze dried .	NNP NN VBZ RB JJR IN JJ NN IN JJ JJ .
Crickets , silk worms , phoenix worms , and various feeder roaches , like red - lobster , turkistan , and dubia , are good example of staple insects to offer your bearded .	NNS , NN NNS , JJ NNS , CC JJ NN NNS , IN VBN , NN , NN , CC NN , VBP JJ NN IN NN NNS TO VB PRP$ VBN .
Wax worms and meal worms should only be offered as treat items , for variety 's sake .	NNP NNS CC JJ NNS MD RB VB VBN IN JJ NNS , IN NN POS NN .
I would highly recommend that you read through some reliable bearded guides to make sure you have everything set up correctly :	PRP MD RB VB IN PRP VBP IN DT JJ VBN NNS TO VB JJ PRP VBP NN VBN RP RB :

When choosing a parakeet look for a young one .	WRB VBG DT NN VB IN DT JJ NN .
( the younger the eaiser to tame ) Look for clean smooth feathers , beak , and clean vent feathers ( the feathers around the butt .. dirty vent feathers means the bird is not healthy ) Look for a dark eye with no circles ( the older ones have a circle ring in their eyes ) .	-LRB- DT JJR DT JJR TO VB -RRB- VB IN JJ JJ NNS , NN , CC JJ NN NNS -LRB- DT NNS IN DT NN , JJ NN NNS VBZ DT NN VBZ RB JJ -RRB- VB IN DT JJ NN IN DT NNS -LRB- DT JJR NNS VBP DT NN NN IN PRP$ NNS -RRB- .
Look for a lot of stripes in their head that starts from the beak and goes back to the back fo the bird .	VB IN DT NN IN NNS IN PRP$ NN WDT VBZ IN DT NN CC VBZ RB IN DT NN IN DT NN .
the stripes are like hair the less stipes the older .	DT NNS VBP IN NN DT JJR NNS DT JJR .
( think of a balding man lol ) Look for clean feathers .	-LRB- VB IN DT VBG NN UH -RRB- VB IN JJ NNS .
If you want a boy the cere ( the nostrils piece above the beak ) must be blue .	IN PRP VBP DT NN DT NN -LRB- DT NNS NN IN DT NN -RRB- MD VB JJ .
The girl has either pink or brown .	DT NN VBZ CC JJ CC JJ .
I would recommend that you get two parakeets .	PRP MD VB IN PRP VBP CD NNS .

These are the steps I used .	DT VBP DT NNS PRP VBD .
Honestly they have worked for me twice with my parakeets .	RB PRP VBP VBN IN PRP RB IN PRP$ NNS .
Hopefully they will work for you .	RB PRP MD VB IN PRP .
1 ) When you get the bird , place him or her or them in the cage .	LS -RRB- WRB PRP VBP DT NN , VB PRP CC PRP CC PRP IN DT NN .
Leave them in there with food and water and such for about 2 hours .	VB PRP IN RB IN NN CC NN CC JJ IN RB CD NNS .
2 ) Then place you hand in the cage .	LS -RRB- RB VB PRP$ NN IN DT NN .
I took the cage and place it next to the couch .	PRP VBD DT NN CC VBD PRP RB IN DT NN .
Then I sat on the couch , placed one hand in the cage , holding a millet spray .	RB PRP VBD IN DT NN , VBD CD NN IN DT NN , VBG DT NN NN .
( this way the will associate your hand with food , and birds love food lol ) Then I turned on the tv and watch .	-LRB- DT NN PRP MD VB PRP$ NN IN NN , CC NNS VBP NN UH -RRB- RB PRP VBD RP DT NN CC VBP .
This way they will see that your hand is good and it s not going to grab them or hurt them .	DT NN PRP MD VB IN PRP$ NN VBZ JJ CC PRP VBZ RB VBG TO VB PRP CC VB PRP .
Do this for about one hour .	VB DT IN RB CD NN .
( you can take breaks if you have too ) and repeat the steps after about 2 hours .	-LRB- PRP MD VB NNS IN PRP VBP TO -RRB- CC VB DT NNS IN RB CD NNS .
3 ) After about day 2 , they will start to eating the millet spray from your hand .	LS -RRB- IN RB NN CD , PRP MD VB TO VBG DT NN NN IN PRP$ NN .
( do not take away the food dish from the birds , they will associate you as the person who takes away their food ) ....	-LRB- VB RB VB RP DT NN NN IN DT NNS , PRP MD VB PRP IN DT NN WP VBZ RP PRP$ NN -RRB- .
Then take your finger and place it under their belly , in front of their feet and say up .	RB VB PRP$ NN CC VB PRP IN PRP$ NN , IN NN IN PRP$ NN CC VB RB .
Push you finger to their feet gently and say up .	VB PRP$ NN IN PRP$ NNS RB CC VB RB .
( the first couple of times they will fly all over the cage but as long as you do nt jump back or screem they will get used to you ) They will have no choice but to go on your finger .	-LRB- DT JJ NN IN NNS PRP MD VB RB IN DT NN CC RB RB IN PRP VBP RB VB RB CC VB PRP MD VB JJ IN PRP -RRB- PRP MD VB DT NN IN TO VB IN PRP$ NN .
When they see that you ar nt harming them , the will go up on your finger when you say up .	WRB PRP VBP IN PRP VBP RB VBG PRP , PRP MD VB RP IN PRP$ NN WRB PRP VBP RB .
4 ) If they are not going up by now you just got ta keep trying and keep trying .	LS -RRB- IN PRP VBP RB VBG RB IN RB PRP RB VBP TO VB VBG CC VB VBG .
